ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Custom writer for Heritrix 3.1
ygData.msgSnippet: To answer your first question about the WUI and why it looks different. Beware that you may be reading documentation for Heritrix 1.?.? Heritrix 3 no longer

To answer your first question about the WUI and why it looks different.
Bew=
are that you may be reading documentation for Heritrix 1.?.?
Heritrix 3 no =
longer contains those tabs and such and has been implemented
with the "Spri=
ng Framework" for configuration files. To learn about the
Heritrix 3 WUI re=
ad  this:
https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Heritrix+3.0+an=
d+3.1+User+Guide


On Sun, Jun 2, 2013 at 3:45 PM, Alireza <alirezanoori@ho=
tmail.com> wrote:

> **
>
>
> Hi,
> Short question:
> How can I implement m=
y own custom logic for saving files? Is there a
> sample? Please guide me.
=
>
> Long description:
> I have a very big project which needs a good crawle=
r. It is used mainly
> for archiving web pages but in a special way. My pre=
vious solution was to
> use crawler4j because it let me easily use my own c=
ode for processing
> downloaded contents. However, due to numerous limitati=
ons, I had to move to
> a better crawler and Heritrix seemed like the perfe=
ct choice.
>
> My question is, how can I create my own custom logic for sav=
ing documents?
>
> So far, I have downloaded the project's source, imported=
 it in Eclipse and
> added the .jar files from the downloaded distributed p=
ackage to classpath.
> Then I passed the required arguments to the org.arch=
ive.crawler.Heritrix
> class and it doesn't contain any errors and I can ac=
cess to the web UI.
> Although it is a little different from what I read in=
 the documentation.
> (for instance it doesn't contain any tabs). Is there =
something wrong here
> or is this the new UI for 3.1?
>
> Now, back to my q=
uestion? What should I do to manually handle saving
> documents? I want to =
download EVERY file type on the web. I want to be able
> to get the documen=
t type because I have to handle HTMLs, JS files, CSS
> files and other type=
s differently. And there is a chance that at some
> points, I need to pause=
 other threads, do some work and then resume the
> work in order to safely =
save files on the disk.
>
> I'm faily new to Heritrix and I'm reading the d=
ocumentation as fast as I
> can. However I'd appreciate if you could point =
me in the right direction
> since I have to deliver this soon and I can't d=
elay the project for much.
>
>  
>

--20cf300fb42517090c04de4404ab

<div dir=3D"ltr">To answer your first question about the WUI and why it loo=
ks different. Beware that you may be reading documentation for Heritrix 1.?=
.?<div style>Heritrix 3 no longer contains those tabs and such and has been=
 implemented with the "Spring Framework" for configuration files.=
 To learn about the Heritrix 3 WUI read =A0this:=A0<a href=3D"https://webar=
chive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Heritrix+3.0+and+3.1+User+Guide">https=
://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Heritrix+3.0+and+3.1+User+Guid=
e</a><br>
</div></div><div class=3D"gmail_extra"><br><br><div class=3D"gmai=
l_quote">On Sun, Jun 2, 2013 at 3:45 PM, Alireza <span dir=3D"ltr"><<a h=
ref=3D"mailto:alirezanoori@..." target=3D"_blank">alirezanoori@hotm=
ail.com</a>></span> wrote:<br>
<blockquote class=3D"gmail_quote" style=
=3D"margin:0 0 0 .8ex;border-left:1px #ccc solid;padding-left:1ex">


<u></=
u>










<div style>
<span>=A0</span>


<div>
  <div>


    <div>
     =
 
      
      <p>Hi,<br>
Short question:<br>
How can I implement my own cu=
stom logic for saving files? Is there a sample? Please guide me.<br>
<br>
L=
ong description:<br>
I have a very big project which needs a good crawler. =
It is used mainly for archiving web pages but in a special way. My previous=
 solution was to use crawler4j because it let me easily use my own code for=
 processing downloaded contents. However, due to numerous limitations, I ha=
d to move to a better crawler and Heritrix seemed like the perfect choice.<=
br>

<br>
My question is, how can I create my own custom logic for saving d=
ocuments?<br>
<br>
So far, I have downloaded the project's source, impo=
rted it in Eclipse and added the .jar files from the downloaded distributed=
 package to classpath. Then I passed the required arguments to the org.arch=
ive.crawler.Heritrix class and it doesn't contain any errors and I can =
access to the web UI. Although it is a little different from what I read in=
 the documentation. (for instance it doesn't contain any tabs). Is ther=
e something wrong here or is this the new UI for 3.1?<br>

<br>
Now, back t=
o my question? What should I do to manually handle saving documents? I want=
 to download EVERY file type on the web. I want to be able to get the docum=
ent type because I have to handle HTMLs, JS files, CSS files and other type=
s differently. And there is a chance that at some points, I need to pause o=
ther threads, do some work and then resume the work in order to safely save=
 files on the disk.<br>

<br>
I'm faily new to Heritrix and I'm rea=
ding the documentation as fast as I can. However I'd appreciate if you =
could point me in the right direction since I have to deliver this soon and=
 I can't delay the project for much.<br>

<br>
</p>

    </div>
     

=
    
    <div style=3D"color:#fff;min-height:0"></div>


</div>



  





=

</blockquote></div><br></div>
